Sentencas: In the present study, the fabrication route, including combining the aerosol deposition method and magnetron sputtering, was demonstrated for the fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques

Sentencas: Thick-film anode layers (approximately 45 mu m) of 10 mol.% gadolinia-doped ceria (GDC) and nickel (57/43 wt% ratio) were deposited by means of the aerosol deposition method on porous metal (Cr-28 wt%, Fe) supports from softly agglomerated submicron powders.
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques

Sentencas: The half-cells with the anode layers were sintered at 1000 degrees C in vacuum.
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques

Sentencas: Thin-film membranes of gadolinia-doped ceria (approximately 4 mu m) were deposited by magnetron sputtering.
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques

Sentencas: (La0.80Sr0.20)(0.95)CoO3-delta (LSC) cathode layers were applied by screen printing with subsequent in situ sintering.
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques

Sentencas: The manufactured cells were investigated by scanning electron microscopy and electrochemical measurements.
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques

Sentencas: Depending on the manufacturing route and testing temperature, the cells with hydrogen as a fuel and air as an oxidant demonstrated open circuit voltages from 0.57 to 0.82 V.
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques

Sentencas: At 750 degrees C, the cell maximum power density was 0.3 W cm(-2).
Titulo: Fabrication of metal-supported solid oxide fuel cells by combining aerosol deposition and magnetron sputtering techniques
